Detailed Description

API for performing a set of Fragment operations.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::add ( Fragment *  fragment,
const base::String &  tag

Calls add(int32_t, Fragment*, const base::String&) with a 0 containerWidgetId.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::add ( int32_t  containerViewId,
Fragment *  fragment 
)

Calls add(int32_t, Fragment*, const base::String&) with a NULL tag.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::add ( int32_t  containerWidgetId,
Fragment *  fragment,
const base::String &  tag 
)

Add a fragment to the page state.

This fragment may optionally also have its view (if Fragment::onCreateWidget returns non-null) into a container widget of the page.

Parameters:
containerWidgetIdOptional identifier of the container this fragment is to be placed in. If 0, it will not be placed in a container.
fragmentThe fragment to be added. This fragment must not already be added to the page.
tagOptional tag name for the fragment, to later retrieve the fragment with FragmentManager::findFragmentByTag(const base::String&).
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::addToBackStack ( const base::String &  name)

Add this transaction to the back stack.

This means that the transaction will be remembered after it is committed, and will reverse its operation when later popped off the stack.

Parameters:
nameAn optional name for this back stack state, or null.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::attach ( Fragment *  fragment)

Re-attach a fragment after it had previously been deatched from the UI with detach(Fragment*).

This causes its view hierarchy to be re-created, attached to the UI, and displayed.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to be attached.
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
int32_t gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::commit ( )

Schedules a commit of this transaction.

The commit does not happen immediately; it will be scheduled as work on the main thread to be done the next time that thread is ready.

A transaction can only be committed with this method prior to its containing page saving its state. If the commit is attempted after that point, an exception will be thrown. This is because the state after the commit can be lost if the page needs to be restored from its state. See commitAllowingStateLoss() for situations where it may be okay to lose the commit.

Returns:
Returns the identifier of this transaction's back stack entry, if addToBackStack(const base::String&) had been called. Otherwise, returns a negative number.
int32_t gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::commitAllowingStateLoss ( )

Like commit but allows the commit to be executed after an page's state is saved.

This is dangerous because the commit can be lost if the page needs to later be restored from its state, so this should only be used for cases where it is okay for the UI state to change unexpectedly on the user.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::detach ( Fragment *  fragment)

Detach the given fragment from the UI.

This is the same state as when it is put on the back stack: the fragment is removed from the UI, however its state is still being page managed by the fragment manager. When going into this state its widget hierarchy is destroyed.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to be detached.
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::disallowAddToBackStack ( )

Disallow calls to addToBackStack(const base::String&).

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::hide ( Fragment *  fragment)

Hides an existing fragment.

This is only relevant for fragments whose widgets have been added to a container, as this will cause the widget to be hidden.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to be hidden.
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
bool gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::isAddToBackStackAllowed ( )

Returns true if this FragmentTransaction is allowed to be added to the back stack.

Returns:
True if addToBackStack(const base::String&) is permitted on this transaction.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::remove ( Fragment *  fragment)

Remove an existing fragment.

If it was added to a container, its widget is also removed from that container.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to be removed.
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::replace ( int32_t  containerWidgetId,
Fragment *  fragment 
)

Calls replace(int32_t, Fragment*, const base::String&) with a NULL tag.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::replace ( int32_t  containerWidgetId,
Fragment *  fragment,
const base::String &  tag 
)

Replace an existing fragment that was added to a container.

This is essentially the same as calling remove(Fragment*) for all currently added fragments that were added with the same containerWidgetId and then add(int32_t, Fragment*, const base::String&) with the same arguments given here.

Parameters:
containerWidgetIdIdentifier of the container whose fragment(s) are to be replaced.
fragmentThe new fragment to place in the container.
tagOptional tag name for the fragment, to later retrieve the fragment with FragmentManager::findFragmentByTag(const base::String&).
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::setTransition ( int32_t  transition)

Select a standard transition animation for this transaction.

May be one of TRANSIT_NONE, TRANSIT_FRAGMENT_OPEN, or TRANSIT_FRAGMENT_CLOSE

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::setTransitionStyle ( int32_t  styleRes)

Set a custom style resource that will be used for resolving transit animations.

FragmentTransaction& gaia::core::FragmentTransaction::show ( Fragment *  fragment)

Shows a previously hidden fragment.

This is only relevant for fragments whose widgets have been added to a container, as this will cause the view to be shown.

Parameters:
fragmentThe fragment to be shown.
Returns:
Returns the same FragmentTransaction instance.
